entries.name: VERSION
entries.description: The basil version

entries.name: RGB
entries.description: Used with b.colorMode() to set the color space.

entries.name: CMYK
entries.description: Used with b.colorMode() to set the color space.

entries.name: LINEAR
entries.description: Used with b.gradientMode() to set the gradient mode.

entries.name: RADIAL
entries.description: Used with b.gradientMode() to set the gradient mode.

entries.name: LOREM
entries.description: Returns a Lorem ipsum string that can be used for testing.

entries.name: width
entries.description: System variable which stores the width of the current page.

entries.name: height
entries.description: System variable which stores the height of the current page.

entries.name: go
entries.description:
Run the sketch! Has to be called in every sketch a the very end of the code.
You may add performance setting options when calling b.go():

entries.name: loop
entries.description: EXPERIMENTAL!

parameters.name: framerate
parameters.description: The framerate per second, determines how often draw() is called per second.

tags.name: framerate
tags.title: param
tags.description: The framerate per second, determines how often draw() is called per second.

entries.name: noLoop
entries.description: EXPERIMENTAL!

entries.name: delay
entries.description:
Suspends the calling thread for a number of milliseconds.
During a sleep period, checks at 100 millisecond intervals to see whether the sleep should be terminated.

entries.name: clear
entries.description: Removes all PageItems (including locked ones) in the given Document, Page, Layer or Group. If the selected container is a Group, the Group itself will be removed as well.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: The container where the PageItems sit in

tags.name: container
tags.title: param
tags.description: The container where the PageItems sit in

entries.name: remove
entries.description: Removes the provided Page, Layer, PageItem, Swatch, etc.

entries.name: doc
entries.description:
Sets or possibly creates the current document and returns it.
If the param doc is not given the current document gets set to the active document
in the application. If no document at all is open, a new document gets created.

parameters.name: doc
parameters.description: The document to set the current document to

tags.name: doc
tags.title: param
tags.description: The document to set the current document to

entries.name: size
entries.description:
Sets the size of the current document, if arguments are given.
If only one argument is given, both the width and the height are set to this value.
If no argument is given, an object containing the current document's width and height is returned.
entries.returns: if no argument is given it returns an object containing the current width and height of the document.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The desired width of the current document

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: optional the desired height of the current document. If not provided the width will be used as the height.

tags.name: width
tags.title: param
tags.description: The desired width of the current document

tags.name: height
tags.title: param
tags.description: optional the desired height of the current document. If not provided the width will be used as the height.

tags.title: return
tags.description: if no argument is given it returns an object containing the current width and height of the document.

entries.name: close
entries.description: Closes the current document.

parameters.name: saveOptions
parameters.description: The indesign SaveOptions constant or either true for triggering saving before closing or false for closing without saving.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Optional: The indesign file instance to save the document to

tags.name: saveOptions
tags.title: param
tags.description: The indesign SaveOptions constant or either true for triggering saving before closing or false for closing without saving.

tags.name: file
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The indesign file instance to save the document to

entries.name: storyCount
entries.description: The number of all stories in the current document.

entries.name: addToStory
entries.description: Adds a page item or a string to an existing story. You can control the position of the insert via the last parameter. It accepts either an InsertionPoint or one the following constants: b.AT_BEGINNING and b.AT_END.

parameters.name: itemOrString
parameters.description: The itemOrString either a PageItem, a String or one the following constants: b.AT_BEGINNING and b.AT_END.

parameters.name: insertionPointOrMode
parameters.description: InsertionPoint or one the following constants: b.AT_BEGINNING and b.AT_END.

tags.name: itemOrString
tags.title: param
tags.description: The itemOrString either a PageItem, a String or one the following constants: b.AT_BEGINNING and b.AT_END.

tags.name: insertionPointOrMode
tags.title: param
tags.description: InsertionPoint or one the following constants: b.AT_BEGINNING and b.AT_END.

entries.name: Group
entries.description: Returns the Group instance and sets it if argument Group is given.

parameters.name: pItem
parameters.description: The PageItems array (must be at least 2) or name of Group name instance

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: (optional) The name of the Group, only when creating a Group from Page Item(s)

tags.name: pItem
tags.title: param
tags.description: The PageItems array (must be at least 2) or name of Group name instance

tags.name: name
tags.title: param
tags.description: (optional) The name of the Group, only when creating a Group from Page Item(s)

entries.name: Group
entries.description: Returns an array of the items that were within the Group before b.ungroup() was called
entries.returns: the Page Item(s) that were grouped

parameters.name: pItem
parameters.description: The Group or name of Group name instance

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the Group, only when creating a Group from Page Item(s)

tags.name: pItem
tags.title: param
tags.description: The Group or name of Group name instance

tags.name: name
tags.title: param
tags.description: The name of the Group, only when creating a Group from Page Item(s)

tags.title: return
tags.description: the Page Item(s) that were grouped

entries.name: guideX
entries.description: Creates a vertical guide line at the current spread and current layer.

entries.name: guideY
entries.description: Creates a horizontal guide line at the current spread and current layer.

entries.name: inspect
entries.description: Prints out all properties and values off an object in a recursive manner to the console. Useful for inspecting (or debugging) nested variable. the default value for the recursion is maxlevel = 2.

entries.name: print
entries.description: Prints a message to the console output in the ExtendScript editor, but unlike b.println() it doesn't return the carriage to a new line at the end.

entries.name: printInfo
entries.description: Print numerous information about the current environment to the console

entries.name: saveStrings
entries.description:
Writes an array of strings to a file, one line per string.
If the given file exists it gets overridden.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file name or a File instance

parameters.name: strings
parameters.description: The string array to be written

tags.name: file
tags.title: param
tags.description: The file name or a File instance

tags.name: strings
tags.title: param
tags.description: The string array to be written

entries.name: saveString
entries.description:
Writes a string to a file.
If the given file exists it gets overridden.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file name or a File instance

tags.name: file
tags.title: param
tags.description: The file name or a File instance

entries.name: savePDF
entries.description: Exports the current document as PDF to the documents folder. Please note, that export options default to the last used export settings.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file name or a File instance

parameters.name: showOptions
parameters.description: Whether to show the export dialog

tags.name: file
tags.title: param
tags.description: The file name or a File instance

tags.name: showOptions
tags.title: param
tags.description: Whether to show the export dialog

entries.name: savePNG
entries.description: Exports the current document as PNG (or sequence of PNG files) to the documents folder. Please note, that export options default to the last used export settings.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file name or a File instance

parameters.name: showOptions
parameters.description: Whether to show the export dialog

tags.name: file
tags.title: param
tags.description: The file name or a File instance

tags.name: showOptions
tags.title: param
tags.description: Whether to show the export dialog

entries.name: download
entries.description: Downloads an URL to a file, currently Mac only.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: A relative file path in the project folder or a File instance

tags.name: file
tags.title: param
tags.description: A relative file path in the project folder or a File instance

entries.name: objectStyle
entries.description:
Returns the object style of a given page item or the object style with the given name. If an
object style of the given name does not exist, it gets created. Optionally a props object of
property name/value pairs can be used to set the object style's properties.

parameters.name: pageItemOrName
parameters.description: A page item whose style to return or the name of the object style to return.

parameters.name: props
parameters.description: Optional: An object of property name/value pairs to set the style's properties.

tags.name: pageItemOrName
tags.title: param
tags.description: A page item whose style to return or the name of the object style to return.

tags.name: props
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: An object of property name/value pairs to set the style's properties.

entries.name: applyObjectStyle
entries.description:
Applies an object style to the given page item. The object style can be given as
name or as an object style instance.
entries.returns: The page item that the style was applied to.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The page item to apply the style to.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: An object style instance or the name of the object style to apply.

tags.name: item
tags.title: param
tags.description: The page item to apply the style to.

tags.name: style
tags.title: param
tags.description: An object style instance or the name of the object style to apply.

tags.title: return
tags.description: The page item that the style was applied to.

entries.name: fill
entries.description: Sets the color or gradient used to fill shapes.

parameters.name: fillColor
parameters.description: Accepts a color/gradient/swatch or a string with the name of a color. Or values: C,M,Y,K / R,G,B / Grey

tags.name: fillColor
tags.title: param
tags.description: Accepts a color/gradient/swatch or a string with the name of a color. Or values: C,M,Y,K / R,G,B / Grey

entries.name: noFill
entries.description:
Disables filling geometry. If both noStroke() and noFill() are called,
newly drawn shapes will be invisible.

entries.name: stroke
entries.description: Sets the color or gradient used to draw lines and borders around shapes.

parameters.name: strokeColor
parameters.description: Accepts a color/gradient/swatch or a string with the name of a color. Or values: C,M,Y,K / R,G,B / Grey

tags.name: strokeColor
tags.title: param
tags.description: Accepts a color/gradient/swatch or a string with the name of a color. Or values: C,M,Y,K / R,G,B / Grey

entries.name: noStroke
entries.description:
Disables drawing the stroke (outline). If both noStroke() and noFill()
are called, nothing will be drawn to the screen.

entries.name: fillTint
entries.description: Sets the tint of the color used to fill shapes.

entries.name: strokeTint
entries.description: Sets the tint of the color used to draw lines and borders around shapes.

entries.name: colorMode
entries.description: Sets the colormode for creating new colors with b.color() to RGB or CMYK. The default color mode is RBG.

entries.name: gradientMode
entries.description: Sets the gradient mode for creating new gradients with b.gradient() to LINEAR or RADIAL. The default gradient mode is LINEAR.

entries.name: color
entries.description: Creates a new RGB or CMYK color and adds the new color to the document, or gets a color by name from the document. The default color mode is RGB.

parameters.name: Get
parameters.description: color: the color name. Create new color: R,G,B,

tags.name: Get
tags.title: param
tags.description: color: the color name. Create new color: R,G,B,[name] or C,M,Y,K,[name] or Grey,name. Name is always optional

entries.name: gradient
entries.description:
Creates a new gradient and adds it to the document, or gets a gradient by name from the document.
If two colors are given as the first two parameters, a gradient is created that blends between these two colors. If an array of colors is used
as the first parameter, a gradient with the contained colors will be created. The colors will be distributed evenly. If additionally to this array
a second array of gradient stop positions is given, the colors will be positioned at the given gradient stops. Possible gradient stop positions
range from 0 to 100. All parameter options allow for an additional name parameter at the end to name the new gradient.
If a string is used as the only parameter, the gradient with that name will be returned, if it exists in the document.

parameters.name: c1
parameters.description: First color of the gradient. Alternatively: Array of colors/gradients or name of gradient to get.

parameters.name: c2
parameters.description: Second color of the gradient. Alternatively: Array of gradient stop positions (if first parameter is an array of colors).

tags.name: c1
tags.title: param
tags.description: First color of the gradient. Alternatively: Array of colors/gradients or name of gradient to get.

tags.name: c2
tags.title: param
tags.description: Second color of the gradient. Alternatively: Array of gradient stop positions (if first parameter is an array of colors).

entries.name: opacity
entries.description: Sets the opacity property of an object.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to set opacity property

tags.name: obj
tags.title: param
tags.description: The object to set opacity property

entries.name: blendMode
entries.description: Sets the Effects blendMode property of an object.

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to set blendMode property

parameters.name: blendMode
parameters.description:
The blendMode must be one of the InDesign BlendMode enum values:
                          BlendMode.NORMAL

tags.name: obj
tags.title: param
tags.description: The object to set blendMode property

tags.name: blendMode
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The blendMode must be one of the InDesign BlendMode enum values: BlendMode.NORMAL
BlendMode.MULTIPLY
BlendMode.SCREEN
BlendMode.OVERLAY
BlendMode.SOFT_LIGHT
BlendMode.HARD_LIGHT
BlendMode.COLOR_DODGE
BlendMode.COLOR_BURN
BlendMode.DARKEN
BlendMode.LIGHTEN
BlendMode.DIFFERENCE
BlendMode.EXCLUSION
BlendMode.HUE
BlendMode.SATURATION
BlendMode.COLOR
BlendMode.LUMINOSITY

entries.name: lerpColor
entries.description:
Calculates a color or colors between two color at a specific increment.
The amt parameter is the amount to interpolate between the two values where 0.0 equal to the first point, 0.1 is very near the first point, 0.5 is half-way in between, etc.
N.B.: Both color must be either CMYK or RGB.

parameters.name: amt
parameters.description: The Amount to interpolate between the two colors

tags.name: amt
tags.title: param
tags.description: The Amount to interpolate between the two colors

entries.name: text
entries.description:
Creates a text frame on the current layer on the current page in the current document.
The text frame gets created in the position specified by the x and y parameters.
The default document font will be used unless a font is set with the textFont() function.
The default document font size will be used unless a font size is set with the textSize() function.
Change the color of the text with the fill() function.
The text displays in relation to the textAlign() and textYAlign() functions.
The width and height parameters define a rectangular area.

parameters.name: txt
parameters.description: The text content to set in the text frame.

tags.name: txt
tags.title: param
tags.description: The text content to set in the text frame.

entries.name: typo
entries.description:
Sets text properties to the given item. If the item is not an instance the text property can be set to,
the property gets set to the direct descendants of the given item, e.g. all stories of a given document.
entries.returns:
The property value(s) if the function acts as getter or the items the property
                                      was assigned to.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The object to apply the property to.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description:
The text property name or an object of key/value property/value pairs.
                                  If property is a string and no value is given, the function acts as getter.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to apply to the property.

tags.name: item
tags.title: param
tags.description: The object to apply the property to.

tags.name: property
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The text property name or an object of key/value property/value pairs.
                                  If property is a string and no value is given, the function acts as getter.

tags.name: value
tags.title: param
tags.description: The value to apply to the property.

tags.title: return
tags.description:
The property value(s) if the function acts as getter or the items the property
                                      was assigned to.

entries.name: textFont
entries.description: Returns the current font and sets it if argument fontName is given.
entries.returns: currFont The name of the current font

parameters.name: fontName
parameters.description: The name of the font to set e.g. Helvetica

tags.name: fontName
tags.title: param
tags.description: The name of the font to set e.g. Helvetica

tags.title: return
tags.description: currFont The name of the current font

entries.name: textSize
entries.description: Returns the current font size in points and sets it if argument pointSize is given.

parameters.name: pointSize
parameters.description: The size in points to set.

tags.name: pointSize
tags.title: param
tags.description: The size in points to set.

entries.name: textAlign
entries.description: Sets the current horizontal and vertical text alignment.

parameters.name: align
parameters.description:
The horizontal text alignment to set. Must be one of the InDesign Justification enum values:
                          Justification.AWAY_FROM_BINDING_SIDE

parameters.name: yAlign
parameters.description:
The vertical text alignment to set. Must be one of the InDesign VerticalJustification enum values:
                          VerticalJustification.BOTTOM_ALIGN

tags.name: align
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The horizontal text alignment to set. Must be one of the InDesign Justification enum values: Justification.AWAY_FROM_BINDING_SIDE
Justification.CENTER_ALIGN
Justification.CENTER_JUSTIFIED
Justification.FULLY_JUSTIFIED
Justification.LEFT_ALIGN
Justification.RIGHT_ALIGN
Justification.RIGHT_JUSTIFIED
Justification.TO_BINDING_SIDE

tags.name: yAlign
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The vertical text alignment to set. Must be one of the InDesign VerticalJustification enum values: VerticalJustification.BOTTOM_ALIGN
VerticalJustification.CENTER_ALIGN
VerticalJustification.JUSTIFY_ALIGN
VerticalJustification.TOP_ALIGN

entries.name: textLeading
entries.description: Returns the spacing between lines of text in units of points and sets it if argument leading is given.

parameters.name: leading
parameters.description:
The spacing between lines of text in units of points or the default Indesign enum
                                  value Leading.AUTO.

tags.name: leading
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The spacing between lines of text in units of points or the default Indesign enum
                                  value Leading.AUTO.

entries.name: textKerning
entries.description: Returns the current kerning and sets it if argument kerning is given.

entries.name: textTracking
entries.description: Returns the current tracking and sets it if argument tracking is given.

entries.name: characterStyle
entries.description:
Returns the character style of a given text object or the character style with the given name. If a
character style of the given name does not exist, it gets created. Optionally a props object of
property name/value pairs can be used to set the character style's properties.

parameters.name: textOrName
parameters.description: A text object whose style to return or the name of the character style to return.

parameters.name: props
parameters.description: Optional: An object of property name/value pairs to set the style's properties.

tags.name: textOrName
tags.title: param
tags.description: A text object whose style to return or the name of the character style to return.

tags.name: props
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: An object of property name/value pairs to set the style's properties.

entries.name: applyCharacterStyle
entries.description:
Applies a character style to the given text object, text frame or story. The character style
can be given as name or as character style instance.
entries.returns: The text that the style was applied to.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text frame, text object or story to apply the style to.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: A character style instance or the name of the character style to apply.

tags.name: text
tags.title: param
tags.description: The text frame, text object or story to apply the style to.

tags.name: style
tags.title: param
tags.description: A character style instance or the name of the character style to apply.

tags.title: return
tags.description: The text that the style was applied to.

Returns the paragraph style of a given text object or the paragraph style with the given name. If a

parameters.name: textOrName
parameters.description: A text object whose style to return or the name of the paragraph style to return.

parameters.description: Optional: An object of property name/value pairs to set the style's properties.

tags.description: A text object whose style to return or the name of the paragraph style to return.

tags.name: props
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: An object of property name/value pairs to set the style's properties.

entries.name: applyParagraphStyle
entries.description:
Applies a paragraph style to the given text object, text frame or story. The paragraph style
can be given as name or as paragraph style instance.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text frame, text object or story to apply the style to.

parameters.name: style
parameters.description: A paragraph style instance or the name of the paragraph style to apply.

tags.name: text

tags.description: The text frame, text object or story to apply the style to.

tags.name: style
tags.title: param
tags.description: A paragraph style instance or the name of the paragraph style to apply.

entries.name: linkTextFrames
entries.description: Links the stories of two textframes to one story. Text of first textframe overflows to second one.

entries.name: placeholder
entries.description: Fills the given textFrame and all linked textFrame with random placeholder text. The placeholder text will be added at the end of any already existing text in the text frame.

entries.name: units
entries.description: Sets the units of the document (like right clicking the rulers). The default units of basil.js are PT.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description: Supported units: PT, PX, CM, MM or IN

tags.name: units
tags.title: param
tags.description: Supported units: PT, PX, CM, MM or IN

entries.name: println
entries.description: Prints a message line to the console output in the ExtendScript editor.

entries.name: PT
entries.description: Used with b.units() to set the coordinate system to points.

entries.name: PX
entries.description: Used with b.units() to set the coordinate system to pixels.

entries.name: CM
entries.description: Used with b.units() to set the coordinate system to centimeters.

entries.name: MM
entries.description: Used with b.units() to set the coordinate system to millimeters.

entries.name: IN
entries.description: Used with b.units() to set the coordinate system to inches.

entries.name: CORNER
entries.description: Corner, used for drawing modes.

entries.name: CORNERS
entries.description: Corners, used for drawing modes.

entries.name: CENTER
entries.description: Center, used for drawing modes.

entries.name: RADIUS
entries.description: Radius, used for drawing modes.

entries.name: CLOSE
entries.description: Close, used for endShape() modes.

entries.name: OPEN
entries.description: Open, used for arc() modes.

entries.name: CHORD
entries.description: Chord, used for arc() modes.

entries.name: PIE
entries.description: Pie, used for arc() modes.

entries.name: ellipse
entries.description: Draws an ellipse (oval) in the display window. An ellipse with an equal
entries.returns: New oval (n.b. in Adobe Scripting the corresponding type is Oval, not Ellipse)

tags.title: return
tags.description: New oval (n.b. in Adobe Scripting the corresponding type is Oval, not Ellipse)

entries.name: line
entries.description: Draws a line (a direct path between two points) to the page.

entries.name: beginShape
entries.description:
Using the beginShape() and endShape() functions allow creating more complex forms.
beginShape() begins recording vertices for a shape and endShape() stops recording.
After calling the beginShape() function, a series of vertex() commands must follow.
To stop drawing the shape, call endShape(). The value of the parameter tells whether the paths to
create from the provided vertices have to be closed or not (to connect the beginning and the end).

parameters.name: shapeMode
parameters.description: Set b.CLOSE if the new Path should be auto-closed.

tags.name: shapeMode
tags.title: param
tags.description: Set b.CLOSE if the new Path should be auto-closed.

entries.name: vertex
entries.description:
Shapes are constructed by connecting a series of vertices. vertex() is used to
specify the vertex coordinates lines and polygons. It is used exclusively within
the beginShape() and endShape() functions.

entries.name: arc
entries.description:
The arc() function draws an arc in the display window.
Arcs are drawn along the outer edge of an ellipse defined by the
entries.returns: newShape (n.b. in Adobe Scripting the corresponding type is a Path Item)

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: optional property defines rendering technique of arc, b.OPEN (default), b.CHORD, or b.PIE

tags.name: mode
tags.title: param
tags.description: optional property defines rendering technique of arc, b.OPEN (default), b.CHORD, or b.PIE

tags.title: return
tags.description:
newShape (n.b. in Adobe Scripting the corresponding type is a Path Item)

TODO(S)
- fix overlapping points bug

entries.name: addPath
entries.description:
addPath() is used to create multi component paths. Call addPath() to add the so far drawn vertices to a single path.
New vertices will then end up in a new path. endShape() will then return a multi path object. All component paths will account for
the setting (see b.CLOSE) given in beginShape(shapeMode).

entries.name: endShape
entries.description:
The endShape() function is the companion to beginShape() and may only be called
after beginShape().

entries.name: rect
entries.description: Draws a rectangle on the page.

entries.name: TWO_PI
entries.description: Two Pi

entries.name: PI
entries.description: Pi

entries.name: HALF_PI
entries.description: Half Pi

entries.name: QUARTER_PI
entries.description: Quarter Pi

entries.name: SINCOS_LENGTH
entries.description: Sin Cos Length

entries.name: EPSILON
entries.description: Epsilon

entries.name: KAPPA
entries.description: Kappa

entries.name: PAGE
entries.description: Used with b.canvasMode() to set the canvas to the full current page.

entries.name: MARGIN
entries.description: Used with b.canvasMode() to set the canvas to the full current page minus the margins.

entries.name: BLEED
entries.description: Used with b.canvasMode() to set the canvas to the full current page plus the bleed.

entries.name: FACING_PAGES
entries.description: Used with b.canvasMode() to set the canvas to use the current facing pages.

entries.name: FACING_BLEEDS
entries.description: Used with b.canvasMode() to set the canvas to use the current facing pages plus bleeds.

entries.name: FACING_MARGINS
entries.description: Used with b.canvasMode() to set the canvas to use the current facing pages minus margins.

entries.name: AT_BEGINNING
entries.description: Used with b.addPage() to set the position of the new page in the book.

entries.name: AT_END
entries.description: Used with b.addPage() to set the position of the new page in the book.

entries.name: BEFORE
entries.description: Used with b.addPage() to set the position of the new page in the book.

entries.name: AFTER
entries.description: Used with b.addPage() to set the position of the new page in the book.

entries.name: canvasMode
entries.description:
Use this to set the dimensions of the canvas. Choose between b.PAGE (default), b.MARGIN, b.BLEED resp. b.FACING_PAGES, b.FACING_MARGINS and b.FACING_BLEEDS for book setups with facing page. Please note: Setups with more than two facing pages are not yet supported.
Please note that you will loose your current MatrixTransformation. You should set the canvasMode before you attempt to use b.translate(), b.rotate() and b.scale();

entries.name: pasteboard
entries.description: Returns the current horizontal and vertical pasteboard margins and sets them if both arguements are given.
entries.returns: The current horizontal, vertical pasteboard margins.

tags.title: return
tags.description: The current horizontal, vertical pasteboard margins.

entries.name: page
entries.description: Returns the current page and sets it if argument page is given. Numbering starts with 1.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page object or page number to set the current page to. If you pass a PageItem the current page will be set to it's containing page.

tags.name: page
tags.title: param
tags.description: The page object or page number to set the current page to. If you pass a PageItem the current page will be set to it's containing page.

entries.name: addPage
entries.description: Adds a new page to the document. Set the optional location parameter to either b.AT_END (default), b.AT_BEGINNING, b.AFTER or b.BEFORE. b.AFTER and b.BEFORE will use the current page as insertion point.

entries.name: removePage
entries.description: Removes a page from the current document. This will either be the current Page if the parameter page is left empty, or the given Page object or page number.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Optional: The page to be removed as Page object or page number.

tags.name: page
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The page to be removed as Page object or page number.

entries.name: pageNumber
entries.description: Returns the current page number of either the current page or the given Page object.
entries.returns: The page number within the document.

parameters.name: pageObj
parameters.description: Optional: The page you want to know the number of.

tags.name: pageObj
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The page you want to know the number of.

tags.title: return
tags.description: The page number within the document.

entries.name: pageCount
entries.description: The number of all pages in the current document.

entries.name: layer
entries.description: Returns the current layer if no argument is given. Sets active layer if layer object or name of existing layer is given. Newly creates layer and sets it to active if new name is given.

parameters.name: layer
parameters.description: The layer or layer name to set the current layer to

tags.name: layer
tags.title: param
tags.description: The layer or layer name to set the current layer to

entries.name: margins
entries.description: Sets the margins of a given page. If 1 value is given, all 4 sides are set equally. If 4 values are given, the current page will be adjusted. Adding a 5th value will set the margin of a given page. Calling the function without any values, will return the margins for the current page.
entries.returns: Current page margins with these properties: top, right, bottom, left

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Top margin or all if only one

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: Sets margins to selected page, currentPage() if left blank

tags.name: top
tags.title: param
tags.description: Top margin or all if only one

tags.name: pageNumber
tags.title: param
tags.description: Sets margins to selected page, currentPage() if left blank

tags.title: return
tags.description: Current page margins with these properties: top, right, bottom, left

entries.name: bleeds
entries.description: Sets the document bleeds. If one value is given, all 4 are set equally. If 4 values are given, the top/right/bottom/left document bleeds will be adjusted. Calling the function without any values, will return the document bleed settings.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Top bleed or all if only one

tags.name: top
tags.title: param
tags.description: Top bleed or all if only one

entries.name: MODESILENT
entries.description: Used with b.go() to set Performance Mode. Disables ScreenRedraw during processing.

entries.name: MODEHIDDEN
entries.description: Used with b.go() to set Performance Mode. Processes Document in background mode. Document will not be visible until the script is done. If you are firing on a open document you'll need to save it before calling b.go(). The document will be removed from the display list and added again after the script is done. In this mode you will likely look at indesign with no open document for quite some time - do not work in indesign during this time. You may want to use b.println("yourMessage") in your script and look at the Console in estk to get information about the process.

entries.name: MODEVISIBLE
entries.description: Default mode. Used with b.go() to set Performance Mode. Processes Document with Screen redraw, use this option to see direct results during the process. This will slow down the process in terms of processing time. This mode was also the default in Versions prior to 0.22

entries.name: stories
entries.description: If no callback function is given it returns a Collection of items otherwise calls the given callback function with each story of the given document.

parameters.name: doc
parameters.description: The document instance to iterate the stories in

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each story. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: story, loopCount;

tags.name: doc
tags.title: param
tags.description: The document instance to iterate the stories in

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each story. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: story, loopCount;

entries.name: paragraphs
entries.description: If no callback function is given it returns a Collection of paragraphs in the container otherwise calls the given callback function with each paragraph of the given document, page, story or textFrame.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: The document, story, page or textFrame instance to iterate the paragraphs in

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each paragraph. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: para, loopCount

tags.name: container
tags.title: param
tags.description: The document, story, page or textFrame instance to iterate the paragraphs in

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each paragraph. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: para, loopCount

entries.name: lines
entries.description: If no callback function is given it returns a Collection of lines in the container otherwise calls the given callback function with each line of the given document, page, story, textFrame or paragraph.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description:
The document, page, story, textFrame or paragraph instance to
                                                  iterate the lines in

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each line. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: line, loopCount

tags.name: container
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The document, page, story, textFrame or paragraph instance to
                                                  iterate the lines in

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each line. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: line, loopCount

entries.name: words
entries.description: If no callback function is given it returns a Collection of words in the container otherwise calls the given callback function with each word of the given document, page, story, textFrame, paragraph or line.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description:
The document, page, story, textFrame, paragraph or line instance
                                                       to iterate the words in

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each word. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: word, loopCount

tags.name: container
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The document, page, story, textFrame, paragraph or line instance
                                                       to iterate the words in

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each word. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: word, loopCount

entries.name: characters
entries.description: If no callback function is given it returns a Collection of characters in the container otherwise calls the given callback function with each character of the given document, page, story, textFrame, paragraph, line or word.
entries.returns: You can use it like an array.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description:
The document, page, story, textFrame, paragraph, line or word instance to
                                                   iterate the characters in

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each character. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: character, loopCount

tags.name: container
tags.title: param
tags.description:
The document, page, story, textFrame, paragraph, line or word instance to
                                                   iterate the characters in

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each character. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: character, loopCount

tags.title: return
tags.description: You can use it like an array.

entries.name: items
entries.description: If no callback function is given it returns a Collection of items otherwise calls the given callback function for each of the PageItems in the given Document, Page, Layer or Group.

parameters.name: container
parameters.description: The container where the PageItems sit in

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call for each PageItem. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: item, loopCount.

tags.name: container
tags.title: param
tags.description: The container where the PageItems sit in

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call for each PageItem. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: item, loopCount.

entries.name: labels
entries.description: Returns items tagged with the given label in the InDesign Script Label pane (Window -> Utilities -> Script Label).
entries.returns: Array of concrete PageItem instances, e.g. TextFrame or SplineItem.

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each item in the search result. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: item, loopCount

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each item in the search result. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: item, loopCount

tags.title: return
tags.description: Array of concrete PageItem instances, e.g. TextFrame or SplineItem.

entries.name: label
entries.description: Returns the first item that is tagged with the given label in the InDesign Script Label pane (Window -> Utilities -> Script Label). Use this instead of b.labels, when you know you just have one thing with that label and don't want to deal with a single-element array.
entries.returns: The first PageItem of all the hits

tags.title: return
tags.description: The first PageItem of all the hits

entries.name: selection
entries.description: Returns the first currently selected object. Use this if you know you only have one selected item and don't want to deal with an array.

entries.name: selections
entries.description: Returns the currently selected object(s)

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each item in the selection. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: item, loopCount

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: Optional: The callback function to call with each item in the selection. When this function returns false the loop stops. Passed arguments: item, loopCount

entries.name: nameOnPage
entries.description: Returns the first item on the active page that is named by the given name in the Layers pane (Window -> Layer).
entries.returns: The first object on the active page with the given name

tags.title: return
tags.description: The first object on the active page with the given name

entries.name: year
entries.description: The year() function returns the current year as an integer (2012, 2013 etc).

entries.name: month
entries.description: The month() function returns the current month as a value from 1 - 12.

entries.name: day
entries.description: The day() function returns the current day as a value from 1 - 31.

entries.name: weekday
entries.description: The weekday() function returns the current weekday as a string from Sunday, Monday, Tuesday...

entries.name: hour
entries.description: The hour() function returns the current hour as a value from 0 - 23.

entries.name: minute
entries.description: The minute() function returns the current minute as a value from 0 - 59.

entries.name: second
entries.description: The second() function returns the current second as a value from 0 - 59.

entries.name: millis
entries.description: Returns the number of milliseconds (thousandths of a second) since starting an applet.

entries.name: millisecond
entries.description: The millisecond() function differs from millis(), in that it returns the exact millisecond (thousandths of a second) of the current time.

entries.name: timestamp
entries.description: The timestamp() function returns the current date formatted as YYYYMMDD_HHMMSS for useful unique filenaming.

entries.name: JSON.decode
entries.returns: Returns JSON-object or throws an error if invalid JSON has been provided.

tags.title: return
tags.description: Returns JSON-object or throws an error if invalid JSON has been provided.

entries.name: JSON.encode

parameters.name: Object
parameters.description: to be converted to a JSON-string

tags.name: Object
tags.title: param
tags.description: to be converted to a JSON-string

entries.name: binary
entries.description:
Converts a byte, char, int, or color to a String containing the
equivalent binary notation. For example color(0, 102, 153, 255)
will convert to the String "11111111000000000110011010011001". This
function can help make your geeky debugging sessions much happier.

entries.name: unbinary
entries.description:
Converts a String representation of a binary number to its
equivalent integer value. For example, unbinary("00001000") will
return 8.

entries.name: hex
entries.description: Convert a number to a hex representation.
entries.returns: The hex representation as a string

parameters.name: len
parameters.description: The length of the hex number to be created, default: 8

tags.name: len
tags.title: param
tags.description: The length of the hex number to be created, default: 8

tags.title: return
tags.description: The hex representation as a string

entries.name: unhex
entries.description: Convert a hex representation to a number.

entries.name: trimWord
entries.description: Removes multiple, leading or trailing spaces and punctuation from "words". E.g. converts "word!" to "word". Especially useful together with b.words();

entries.name: join
entries.description:
Combines an array of Strings into one String, each separated by
the character(s) used for the separator parameter. To join arrays
of ints or floats, it's necessary to first convert them to strings
using nf() or nfs().

entries.name: split
entries.description:
The split() function breaks a string into pieces using a
character or string as the divider. The delim parameter specifies the
character or characters that mark the boundaries between each piece. A
String[] array is returned that contains each of the pieces.

parameters.name: delim
parameters.description: The string used to separate the data

tags.name: delim
tags.title: param
tags.description: The string used to separate the data

entries.name: splitTokens
entries.description:
The splitTokens() function splits a String at one or many character
"tokens." The tokens parameter specifies the character or characters
to be used as a boundary.

parameters.name: tokens
parameters.description: list of individual characters that will be used as separators

tags.name: tokens
tags.title: param
tags.description: list of individual characters that will be used as separators

entries.name: nf
entries.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings. There
are two versions, one for formatting floats and one for formatting
ints. The values for the digits, left, and right parameters should
always be positive integers.

entries.name: nfs
entries.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings. Similar to nf()
but leaves a blank space in front of positive numbers so they align
with negative numbers in spite of the minus symbol. There are two
versions, one for formatting floats and one for formatting ints. The
values for the digits, left, and right parameters should always be
positive integers.

entries.name: nfp
entries.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings. Similar to nf()
but puts a "+" in front of positive numbers and a "-" in front of
negative numbers. There are two versions, one for formatting floats
and one for formatting ints. The values for the digits, left, and right
parameters should always be positive integers.

entries.name: nfc
entries.description:
Utility function for formatting numbers into strings and placing
appropriate commas to mark units of 1000. There are two versions, one
for formatting ints and one for formatting an array of ints. The value
for the digits parameter should always be a positive integer.

entries.name: trim
entries.description:
Removes whitespace characters from the beginning and end of a String.
In addition to standard whitespace characters such as space, carriage
return, and tab, this function also removes the Unicode "nbsp" character.
entries.returns: Returns the input in a trimmed way

parameters.name: str
parameters.description: A string or an array of strings to be trimmed

tags.name: str
tags.title: param
tags.description: A string or an array of strings to be trimmed

tags.title: return
tags.description: Returns the input in a trimmed way

entries.name: isURL
entries.description: Checks whether an URL string is valid.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: An url string to be checked

tags.name: url
tags.title: param
tags.description: An url string to be checked

entries.name: endsWith
entries.description: Checks whether a string ends with a specific character or string.

entries.name: startsWith
entries.description: Checks whether a string starts with a specific character or string.

entries.name: shellExecute
entries.description: Executes a shell command and returns the result, currently Mac only.

entries.name: loadString
entries.description:
Reads the contents of a file or loads an URL into a String.
If the file is specified by name as String, it must be located in the document's data directory.

parameters.name: fileOrString
parameters.description: The text file name in the document's data directory or a File instance or an URL

tags.name: fileOrString
tags.title: param
tags.description: The text file name in the document's data directory or a File instance or an URL

entries.name: loadStrings
entries.description:
Reads the contents of a file or loads an URL and creates a String array of its individual lines.
If the file is specified by name as String, it must be located in the document's data directory.
entries.returns: Array of the individual lines in the given File or URL

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The text file name in the document's data directory or a File instance or an URL

tags.name: file
tags.title: param
tags.description: The text file name in the document's data directory or a File instance or an URL

tags.title: return
tags.description: Array of the individual lines in the given File or URL

entries.name: rectMode
entries.description:
Modifies the location from which rectangles draw. The default mode is
rectMode(CORNER), which specifies the location to be the upper left
corner of the shape and uses the third and fourth parameters of rect()
to specify the width and height. The syntax rectMode(CORNERS) uses the
first and second parameters of rect() to set the location of one corner
and uses the third and fourth parameters to set the opposite corner.
The syntax rectMode(CENTER) draws the image from its center point and
uses the third and forth parameters of rect() to specify the image's
width and height. The syntax rectMode(RADIUS) draws the image from its
center point and uses the third and forth parameters of rect() to specify
half of the image's width and height. The parameter must be written in
"ALL CAPS".

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Either b.CORNER, b.CORNERS, b.CENTER, or b.RADIUS

tags.name: mode
tags.title: param
tags.description: Either b.CORNER, b.CORNERS, b.CENTER, or b.RADIUS

entries.name: ellipseMode
entries.description:
The origin of the ellipse is modified by the ellipseMode() function.
The default configuration is ellipseMode(CENTER), which specifies the
location of the ellipse as the center of the shape. The RADIUS mode is
the same, but the width and height parameters to ellipse() specify the
radius of the ellipse, rather than the diameter. The CORNER mode draws
the shape from the upper-left corner of its bounding box. The CORNERS
mode uses the four parameters to ellipse() to set two opposing corners
of the ellipse's bounding box. The parameter must be written in "ALL CAPS".

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Either b.CENTER, b.RADIUS, b.CORNER, or b.CORNERS

tags.name: mode
tags.title: param
tags.description: Either b.CENTER, b.RADIUS, b.CORNER, or b.CORNERS

entries.name: strokeWeight
entries.description:
Sets the width of the stroke used for lines and the border
around shapes.

entries.name: duplicate
entries.description: Duplicates the given page after the current page or the given pageitem to the current page and layer. Use b.rectMode() to set center point.

entries.name: bounds
entries.description:
The function calculates the geometric bounds of any given object. Use b.itemX(), b.itemY(), b.itemPosition(), b.itemWidth(), b.itemHeight() and b.itemSize() to modify PageItems.
In case the object is any kind of text, then additional typographic information baseline and xHeight are calculated
entries.returns: Geometric bounds object with these properties: width, height, left, right, top, bottom and for text: baseline, xHeight

parameters.name: obj
parameters.description: The object to calculate the geometric bounds

tags.name: obj
tags.title: param
tags.description: The object to calculate the geometric bounds

tags.title: return
tags.description: Geometric bounds object with these properties: width, height, left, right, top, bottom and for text: baseline, xHeight

entries.name: itemX
entries.description: Positions a PageItem at the designated spot on the x axis. If no x argument is given the current x position is returned.

entries.name: itemY
entries.description: Positions a PageItem at the designated spot on the y axis. If no y argument is given the current y position is returned.

entries.name: itemWidth
entries.description: Scales the given PageItem to the given width. If width is not given as argument the current width is returned.

entries.name: itemHeight
entries.description: Scales the given PageItem to the given height. If height is not given as argument the current height is returned.

entries.name: itemPosition
entries.description: Moves the given PageItem to the given position. If x or y is not given as argument the current position is returned.
entries.returns: Returns an object with the fields x and y

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Returns an object with the fields x and y

entries.name: itemSize
entries.description: Scales the given PageItem to the given size. If width or height is not given as argument the current size is returned.
entries.returns: Returns an object with the fields width and height

tags.title: returns
tags.description: Returns an object with the fields width and height

entries.name: matrix
entries.description: Returns the current matrix as a Matrix2D object for altering existing PageItems with b.transform(). If a Matrix2D object is provided to the function it will overwrite the current matrix.

parameters.name: matrix
parameters.description: The matrix to be set as new current matrix

tags.name: matrix
tags.title: param
tags.description: The matrix to be set as new current matrix

entries.name: transform
entries.description: Transforms the given PageItem with the given Matrix2D object.

entries.name: applyMatrix
entries.description: Multiplies the current matrix by the one specified through the parameters.

entries.name: popMatrix
entries.description: Pops the current transformation matrix off the matrix stack. Understanding pushing and popping requires understanding the concept of a matrix stack. The pushMatrix() function saves the current coordinate system to the stack and popMatrix() restores the prior coordinate system. pushMatrix() and popMatrix() are used in conjuction with the other transformation methods and may be embedded to control the scope of the transformations.

entries.name: printMatrix
entries.description: Prints the current matrix to the console window.

entries.name: pushMatrix
entries.description: Pushes the current transformation matrix onto the matrix stack. Understanding pushMatrix() and popMatrix() requires understanding the concept of a matrix stack. The pushMatrix() function saves the current coordinate system to the stack and popMatrix() restores the prior coordinate system. pushMatrix() and popMatrix() are used in conjuction with the other transformation methods and may be embedded to control the scope of the transformations.

entries.name: resetMatrix
entries.description: Replaces the current matrix with the identity matrix.

entries.name: rotate
entries.description: Rotates an object the amount specified by the angle parameter. Angles should be specified in radians (values from 0 to PI*2) or converted to radians with the radians() function. Objects are always rotated around their relative position to the origin and positive numbers rotate objects in a clockwise direction with 0 radians or degrees being up and HALF_PI being to the right etc. Transformations apply to everything that happens after and subsequent calls to the function accumulates the effect. For example, calling rotate(PI/2) and then rotate(PI/2) is the same as rotate(PI). If rotate() is called within the draw(), the transformation is reset when the loop begins again. Technically, rotate() multiplies the current transformation matrix by a rotation matrix. This function can be further controlled by the pushMatrix() and popMatrix().

entries.name: scale
entries.description:
Increasing and decreasing the size of an object by expanding and contracting vertices. Scale values are specified as decimal percentages. The function call scale(2.0) increases the dimension of a shape by 200%. Objects always scale from their relative origin to the coordinate system. Transformations apply to everything that happens after and subsequent calls to the function multiply the effect. For example, calling scale(2.0) and then scale(1.5) is the same as scale(3.0). If scale() is called within draw(), the transformation is reset when the loop begins again. This function can be further controlled by pushMatrix() and popMatrix().
If only one parameter is given, it is applied on X and Y axis.

parameters.name: scaleX
parameters.description: The amount to scale the X axis.

parameters.name: scaleY
parameters.description: The amount to scale the Y axis.

tags.name: scaleX
tags.title: param
tags.description: The amount to scale the X axis.

tags.name: scaleY
tags.title: param
tags.description: The amount to scale the Y axis.

entries.name: translate
entries.description: Specifies an amount to displace objects within the page. The x parameter specifies left/right translation, the y parameter specifies up/down translation. Transformations apply to everything that happens after and subsequent calls to the function accumulates the effect. For example, calling translate(50, 0) and then translate(20, 0) is the same as translate(70, 0). This function can be further controlled by the pushMatrix() and popMatrix().

parameters.name: tx
parameters.description: The amount of offset on the X axis.

parameters.name: ty
parameters.description: The amount of offset on the Y axis.

tags.name: tx
tags.title: param
tags.description: The amount of offset on the X axis.

tags.name: ty
tags.title: param
tags.description: The amount of offset on the Y axis.

entries.name: image
entries.description:
Adds an image to the document. If the image argument is given as a string the image file must be in the document's
data directory which is in the same directory where the document is saved in. The image argument can also be a File
instance which can be placed even before the document was saved.
The second argument can either be the x position of the frame to create or an instance of a rectangle,
oval or polygon to place the image in. If an x position is given, a y position must be given, too.
If x and y positions are given and width and height are not given, the frame's size gets set to the original image size.
entries.returns: The item instance the image was placed in.

parameters.name: img
parameters.description: The image file name in the document's data directory or a File instance

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x position on the current page or the item instance to place the image in

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y position on the current page. Ignored if x is not a number.

parameters.name: w
parameters.description: The width of the rectangle to add the image to. Ignored if x is not a number.

parameters.name: h
parameters.description: The height of the rectangle to add the image to. Ignored if x is not a number.

tags.name: img
tags.title: param
tags.description: The image file name in the document's data directory or a File instance

tags.name: x
tags.title: param
tags.description: The x position on the current page or the item instance to place the image in

tags.name: y
tags.title: param
tags.description: The y position on the current page. Ignored if x is not a number.

tags.name: w
tags.title: param
tags.description: The width of the rectangle to add the image to. Ignored if x is not a number.

tags.name: h
tags.title: param
tags.description: The height of the rectangle to add the image to. Ignored if x is not a number.

tags.title: return
tags.description: The item instance the image was placed in.

entries.name: transformImage
entries.description:
Transforms position and size of an image.
The image fit options are always "contentToFrame".

entries.name: imageMode
entries.description:
Modifies the location from which images draw. The default mode is imageMode(CORNER), which specifies the location to be the upper left corner and uses the fourth and fifth parameters of image() to set the image's width and height. The syntax imageMode(CORNERS) uses the second and third parameters of image() to set the location of one corner of the image and uses the fourth and fifth parameters to set the opposite corner. Use imageMode(CENTER) to draw images centered at the given x and y position.
If no parameter is passed the currently set mode is returned as String.

entries.name: abs
entries.description: Calculates the absolute value (magnitude) of a number. The absolute value of a number is always positive.
entries.returns: The absolute value of that number

tags.title: return
tags.description: The absolute value of that number

entries.name: ceil
entries.description: Calculates the closest int value that is greater than or equal to the value of the parameter. For example, ceil(9.03) returns the value 10.

entries.name: constrain
entries.description: Constrains a value to not exceed a maximum and minimum value.

entries.name: dist
entries.description: Calculates the distance between two points.

parameters.name: x1
parameters.description: the x-coordinate of the first point

parameters.name: y1
parameters.description: the y-coordinate of the first point

parameters.name: x2
parameters.description: the x-coordinate of the second point

parameters.name: y2
parameters.description: the y-coordinate of the second point

tags.name: x1
tags.title: param
tags.description: the x-coordinate of the first point

tags.name: y1
tags.title: param
tags.description: the y-coordinate of the first point

tags.name: x2
tags.title: param
tags.description: the x-coordinate of the second point

tags.name: y2
tags.title: param
tags.description: the y-coordinate of the second point

entries.name: exp
entries.description: Returns Euler's number e (2.71828...) raised to the power of the value parameter.

entries.name: floor
entries.description: Calculates the closest int value that is less than or equal to the value of the parameter.

entries.name: lerp
entries.description: Calculates a number between two numbers at a specific increment. The amt parameter is the amount to interpolate between the two values where 0.0 equal to the first point, 0.1 is very near the first point, 0.5 is half-way in between, etc. The lerp function is convenient for creating motion along a straight path and for drawing dotted lines.

entries.name: log
entries.description: Calculates the natural logarithm (the base-e logarithm) of a number. This function expects the values greater than 0.0.

entries.name: mag
entries.description: Calculates the magnitude (or length) of a vector. A vector is a direction in space commonly used in computer graphics and linear algebra. Because it has no "start" position, the magnitude of a vector can be thought of as the distance from coordinate (0,0) to its (x,y) value. Therefore, mag() is a shortcut for writing "dist(0, 0, x, y)".

entries.name: map
entries.description: Re-maps a number from one range to another. In the example above, the number '25' is converted from a value in the range 0..100 into a value that ranges from the left edge (0) to the right edge (width) of the screen.

entries.name: max
entries.description: Determines the largest value in a sequence of numbers.

parameters.name: param1
parameters.description: Either the first value or an array of Numbers

tags.name: param1
tags.title: param
tags.description: Either the first value or an array of Numbers

entries.name: min
entries.description: Determines the smallest value in a sequence of numbers.

parameters.name: param1
parameters.description: Either the first value or an array of Numbers

tags.name: param1
tags.title: param
tags.description: Either the first value or an array of Numbers

entries.name: norm
entries.description: Normalizes a number from another range into a value between 0 and 1.

parameters.name: low
parameters.description: The lowest value to be expected

parameters.name: low
parameters.description: The highest value to be expected

tags.name: low
tags.title: param
tags.description: The lowest value to be expected

tags.name: low
tags.title: param
tags.description: The highest value to be expected

entries.name: pow
entries.description: Facilitates exponential expressions. The pow() function is an efficient way of multiplying numbers by themselves (or their reciprocal) in large quantities. For example, pow(3, 5) is equivalent to the expression 3

parameters.name: exponent
parameters.description: power of which to raise the base

tags.name: exponent
tags.title: param
tags.description: power of which to raise the base

entries.name: round
entries.description: Calculates the integer closest to the value parameter. For example, round(9.2) returns the value 9.

entries.name: sq
entries.description: Squares a number (multiplies a number by itself). The result is always a positive number, as multiplying two negative numbers always yields a positive result. For example, -1 * -1 = 1.

entries.name: sqrt
entries.description: Calculates the square root of a number. The square root of a number is always positive, even though there may be a valid negative root. The square root s of number a is such that s*s = a. It is the opposite of squaring.

entries.name: acos
entries.description: The inverse of cos(), returns the arc cosine of a value. This function expects the values in the range of -1 to 1 and values are returned in the range 0 to PI (3.1415927).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the value whose arc cosine is to be returned

tags.name: value
tags.title: param
tags.description: the value whose arc cosine is to be returned

entries.name: asin
entries.description: The inverse of sin(), returns the arc sine of a value. This function expects the values in the range of -1 to 1 and values are returned in the range 0 to PI (3.1415927).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the value whose arc sine is to be returned

tags.name: value
tags.title: param
tags.description: the value whose arc sine is to be returned

entries.name: atan
entries.description: The inverse of tan(), returns the arc tangent of a value. This function expects the values in the range of -1 to 1 and values are returned in the range 0 to PI (3.1415927).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: the value whose arc tangent is to be returned

tags.name: value
tags.title: param
tags.description: the value whose arc tangent is to be returned

entries.name: atan2
entries.description: Calculates the angle (in radians) from a specified point to the coordinate origin as measured from the positive x-axis. Values are returned as a float in the range from PI to -PI. The atan2() function is most often used for orienting geometry to the position of the cursor. Note: The y-coordinate of the point is the first parameter and the x-coordinate is the second due the the structure of calculating the tangent.

entries.name: cos
entries.description: Calculates the cosine of an angle. This function expects the values of the angle parameter to be provided in radians (values from 0 to PI*2). Values are returned in the range -1 to 1.

entries.name: degrees
entries.description: Converts a radian measurement to its corresponding value in degrees. Radians and degrees are two ways of measuring the same thing. There are 360 degrees in a circle and 2*PI radians in a circle. For example, 90 = PI/2 = 1.5707964. All trigonometric methods in Processing require their parameters to be specified in radians.

entries.name: radians
entries.description: Converts a degree measurement to its corresponding value in radians. Radians and degrees are two ways of measuring the same thing. There are 360 degrees in a circle and 2*PI radians in a circle. For example, 90 = PI/2 = 1.5707964. All trigonometric methods in Processing require their parameters to be specified in radians.

entries.name: sin
entries.description: Calculates the sine of an angle. This function expects the values of the angle parameter to be provided in radians (values from 0 to 6.28). Values are returned in the range -1 to 1.

entries.name: tan
entries.description: Calculates the ratio of the sine and cosine of an angle. This function expects the values of the angle parameter to be provided in radians (values from 0 to PI*2). Values are returned in the range infinity to -infinity.

entries.name: random
entries.description: Generates random numbers. Each time the random() function is called, it returns an unexpected value within the specified range. If one parameter is passed to the function it will return a float between zero and the value of the high parameter. The function call random(5) returns values between 0 and 5. If two parameters are passed, it will return a float with a value between the the parameters. The function call random(-5, 10.2) returns values between -5 and 10.2.

parameters.name: low
parameters.description: The low border of the range

parameters.name: high
parameters.description: The high border of the range

tags.name: low
tags.title: param
tags.description: The low border of the range

tags.name: high
tags.title: param
tags.description: The high border of the range

entries.name: noise
entries.description: Returns the Perlin noise value at specified coordinates. Perlin noise is a random sequence generator producing a more natural ordered, harmonic succession of numbers compared to the standard random() function. It was invented by Ken Perlin in the 1980s and been used since in graphical applications to produce procedural textures, natural motion, shapes, terrains etc.

entries.name: noiseDetail
entries.description: Adjusts the character and level of detail produced by the Perlin noise function. Similar to harmonics in physics, noise is computed over several octaves. Lower octaves contribute more to the output signal and as such define the overal intensity of the noise, whereas higher octaves create finer grained details in the noise sequence. By default, noise is computed over 4 octaves with each octave contributing exactly half than its predecessor, starting at 50% strength for the 1st octave. This falloff amount can be changed by adding an additional function parameter. Eg. a falloff factor of 0.75 means each octave will now have 75% impact (25% less) of the previous lower octave. Any value between 0.0 and 1.0 is valid, however note that values greater than 0.5 might result in greater than 1.0 values returned by noise().

parameters.name: octaves
parameters.description: number of octaves to be used by the noise() function

tags.name: octaves
tags.title: param
tags.description: number of octaves to be used by the noise() function

entries.name: noiseSeed
entries.description: Sets the seed value for noise(). By default, noise() produces different results each time the program is run. Set the value parameter to a constant to return the same pseudo-random numbers each time the software is run.

entries.name: forEach
entries.description: Used to run a function on all elements of an array. Please note the existance of the convenience methods b.stories(), b.paragraphs(), b.lines(), b.words() and b.characters() that are used to iterate through all instances of the given type in the given document.

parameters.name: cb
parameters.description: The function that will be called on each element. The call will be like function(item,i) where i is the current index of the item within the array.

tags.name: cb
tags.title: param
tags.description: The function that will be called on each element. The call will be like function(item,i) where i is the current index of the item within the array.

entries.name: HashList
entries.description: HashList is a data container that allows you to store information as key -> value pairs. As usual in JavaScript mixed types of keys and values are accepted in one HashList instance.

entries.name: HashList.remove
entries.description: This removes a key -> value pair by its key.

entries.name: HashList.get
entries.description: This gets a value by its key.

entries.name: HashList.set
entries.description: This sets a key -> value pair. If a key is already existing, the value will be updated. Please note that Functions are currently not supported as values.

entries.name: HashList.hasKey
entries.description: Checks for the existence of a given key.

entries.name: HashList.hasValue
entries.description: Checks if a certain value exists at least once in all of the key -> value pairs.

entries.name: HashList.getKeysByValues
entries.description: Returns an array of all keys that are sorted by their values from highest to lowest. Please note that this only works if you have conistently used Numbers for values.
entries.returns: An array with all the keys

tags.title: return
tags.description: An array with all the keys

entries.name: HashList.getSortedKeys
entries.description: Returns an array with all keys in a sorted order from higher to lower magnitude.
entries.returns: An array with all the keys

tags.title: return
tags.description: An array with all the keys

entries.name: HashList.getKeys
entries.description: Returns an array with all keys.
entries.returns: An array with all the keys

tags.title: return
tags.description: An array with all the keys

entries.name: HashList.getKeys
entries.description: Returns an array with all keys.
entries.returns: An array with all the keys

tags.title: return
tags.description: An array with all the keys

entries.name: HashList.clear
entries.description: Deletes all the key -> value pairs in this HashList.

entries.name: CSV.delimiter
entries.description: Sets the delimiter of the CSV decode and encode function.
entries.returns: Returns the current delimiter if called without argument

parameters.description: Optional Sets the delimiter for CSV parsing

CSV.encode

entries.description: Checks whether a var is an Array, returns true if this is the case
entries.returns: returns true if this is the case

entries.description: Checks whether a var is a number, returns true if this is the case

entries.name: isText
entries.description:
Checks whether a var is an indesign text object, returns true if this is the case
NB: a indesign TextFrame will return false as it is just a container holding text.
So you could say that isText() refers to all the things inside a TextFrame.
entries.returns: returns true if this is the case

entries.name: projectFolder
entries.description: Get the folder of the active document as a Folder object. Use .absoluteURI to access a string representation of the folder path.
entries.returns: The folder of the the active document

tags.title: return
tags.description: The folder of the the active document

entries.name: Vector
entries.description: A class to describe a two or three dimensional vector. This datatype stores two or three variables that are commonly used as a position, velocity, and/or acceleration. Technically, position is a point and velocity and acceleration are vectors, but this is often simplified to consider all three as vectors. For example, if you consider a rectangle moving across the screen, at any given instant it has a position (the object's location, expressed as a point.), a velocity (the rate at which the object's position changes per time unit, expressed as a vector), and acceleration (the rate at which the object's velocity changes per time unit, expressed as a vector). Since vectors represent groupings of values, we cannot simply use traditional addition/multiplication/etc. Instead, we'll need to do some "vector" math, which is made easy by the methods inside the Vector class.
